thread.title: One factor that makes the Jets a lock to cover vs. Patriots
thread.title_full: One factor that makes the Jets a lock to cover vs. Patriots | New York Post

author: The Wildcat
title: One factor that makes the Jets a lock to cover vs. Patriots
text:
Including the 1997-2014 seasons in The Post, Cat’s record in print stands at 523-440 (54 percent) against the spread. 
Saturday Utah (+3¹/₂) over USC: Up by seven, after three quarters, Trojans acted as if their defensive backfield could keep getting away with single coverage on Irish receivers, but alas, Notre Dame scored the final 17 points to draw clear. Now, with their interim coach, they’re tangibly favored against this season’s Pac-12 Little Engines that Could? With their altitude-oxygenated advantage (4,327 feet!), cohesive Utes (with their pacesetting 13 seasonal interceptions) provide USC yet another humility lesson they so badly need . USC? Characters! Utah? Character … for one unit.
Sunday Jets (+8¹/₂) over PATRIOTS: To restate the obvious, Bill Belichick is anything but an idiot, so he knows he’s in for an enervating challenge here against a double-sharp head coach who needn’t rely on bluster to get his points across. Patriots haven’t lost a regular-season home game (in which they had something to play for) straight-up since Colin Kaepernick’s fifth start for the 49ers, back in 2012 — but their injury-decimated, reshuffled offensive line is problematic against this stellar Jet front. Soar with Your Jets, for one unit.
Last week: 1-1. USC (L). Dolphins (W) .
Season: 11-4
Follow the weekly progress of all of The Wildcat’s monitored NFL selections at http://www.thesportsmonitor.com/15nfl.html
